intro: Astragalus confertiformis, commonly known as the broadleaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in poor soil conditions. Astragalus confertiformis plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinator populations.
